info.name: Abbey Learning API
info.description:
By Tolulope Mumuney

A documentation of the API backing Abbey Learning, describing all its routes and endpoints.

User roles:  
"student" | "admin" | "teacher" | "other"

Endpoints require the basic API Key and uses both basic auth headers and a passport token architecture.

Some routes for creation require "pass" in the header: \["auth/signup", "auth/login"\]

request.description:
All Roles.

The initiate login endpoint will need both the user email and password in the requests body.

This endpoint will verify a user's password by comparing it with the hashed version in the db. If successful, it'll generate a token passport and send back as cookie also. Note: This token will expire in 90d for now.

request.description: All fields in sample req.body required.

Can get a user, regardless of role, user userID param: url/key/:userID

Can get a user by email query: url/key?email=email

Can get a user by role query: url/key?role=role ("student", "admin", "teacher", "other")

Can get a user by role query: url/key?student_number=student_number

Note: if no query or param added, server will return all users in the db

request.description:
Update profile picture of any user type. Images should come in either jpeg, png, or jpg and will be saved in an AWS s3 bucket. Filename will be auto given to the file based on useer's name. 

In the multipart/form-data, the file must be in the "photo" field please.

Update user's basic profile details. Can update first_name, last_name, address, mobile, and about.

If any field in the address is to be edited, the entire address object must be sent back, including addressString field.

A course is a combination/array of resources. In other words, an array of topics. The course description, name, category, and at least one element of the teacher's array is required. The tecahers in the teachers array must have role teacher mapped in the db.  
  
Each resource can have videos, text content, external links, etc. See sample req.body for allowed fileds.

Only users with role student can register for a course. ID of student will be mapped to the course and a ref also created in the students array.

A course tracker will be created for the user upon course regsitration for tracking course progress as need. This course tracker will be in the student's data.

This majorly interacts with the course_tracker under a user's data. The course_tracker marks progress of a specific course in your courses box, hence, any courseID and topicIn added to the req.body needs to tally. Upon progress report, the current_topic and topics_resolved fields in the course_tracker will be updated accordingly. The progress of the course, calculated in percentange will also be recorded after hitting this endpoint.

Since all user's have a course tracker array, this endpoint gets all students under a course and then calculates/sorts them by the completion rate for each course.

Each of the user trackers added also return a progress rating in percent for the user under the progress field.

request.description:
Can get a course by category: url?category=category

Can get a course by name: url?name=name (NOTE: split spaces in course name by comma) (Not case sensitive)

Can get a user by course id auto generated by db: url?id=id

Note: if no query or param added, server will return all users in the db

response.name: Get User Copy

request.description:
A classroom was created to be a combination of courses for students that don't register directly for individual courses.

The teachers and courses array in the req.body should be array of IDs also.

Meetings being set for classes should have platform, duration, instructions, link, courses, and date milliseconds.

Please note, the courses added to a class must exist in the courses collection. This also applies to the ID strings in the teachers array.

response.name: Create A Course Copy

request.description:
Only users with role student can register for a class. ID of student will be mapped to the course and a ref also created in the students array.

All classes to be registered for must be existing classes.

Can get a course by title: url?title=title (NOTE: split spaces in course name by comma) (Not case sensitive)

Can get a user by course id auto generated by db: url?id=id

Note: if no query or param added, server will return all users in the db

response.name: Get Classes

item.name: Get Signed AWS URL for File/Image

request.description:
Fetches images/files fro AWS s3 bucket for app services.

This endpoint requires two params, the folder name and the file name.

Existing folders in our AWS Bucket include:  
- products
- profile-pictures

Note: This returned url from AWS will expire after some time. Returned URL will work for any file format as needed or uploaded via other endpoints.
